data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Spontaneously Resolved Chiral Interpenetrating 3-D Nets with Two Different Zinc Coordination Polymers

data.question: Who is the corresponding author for the article?
What is the publication date of the article?
What is the yield percentage of the synthesized complex 1?
What type of ligand is 2,4-Di-(4-pyiridyl)-1,3,5-triazine (DPT)?
What is the space group of complex 1?
What is the role of DPT in the synthesis of complex 1?
data.answer: DPT acts as a bridging ligand connecting zinc atoms to form 3-D nets.

data.question: How does the synthesis of complex 1 demonstrate spontaneous resolution?
data.answer: Each individual crystal of complex 1 consists of a single enantiomer in the solid state, demonstrating spontaneous resolution.

data.question: What are the axial ligands in net A and net B of complex 1?
data.answer: CH3CN molecules in net A and water molecules in net B

data.question: What is the significance of the chiral space group in complex 1?
data.answer: The chiral space group indicates that the complex has a specific handedness, contributing to its chiral properties.

data.question: How are the zinc atoms coordinated in complex 1?
data.answer: Each zinc(II) ion is coordinated by four neutral DPT bridging ligands at the equatorial positions and two axial ligands, forming a slightly distorted octahedral coordination environment.

data.question: What is the role of the solvent mixture in the synthesis of complex 1?
data.answer: The solvent mixture of CH3CN-CHCl3 is used to facilitate the reaction between Zn(ClO4)2Â·6H2O and DPT, leading to the formation of complex 1.

data.question: Is complex 1 synthesized using a net-based approach?
Does complex 1 consist of two topologically equivalent 3-D nets?
Is the synthesis of complex 1 an example of stereospecific self-assembly?
Are the two interpenetrating nets in complex 1 of identical chemical composition?
Does complex 1 crystallize in a non-chiral space group?
Is DPT a flexible ligand that allows for various geometries upon metal complexation?
Is the handedness of the helical structures in nets A and B the same?
Does the synthesis of complex 1 involve chiral auxiliaries?
